data.prayer: Father, please raise up every one you have called in Bhojpur, Bihar, India to become worthy of their calling, and offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to you through Jesus.
data.verse: I urge you to live a life worthy of the calling you have received

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Bhojpur, Bihar, India
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Father, we pray for every movement leader and disciple in the county of Bhojpur, Bihar, India that they would have deepening intimacy with you.
data.verse: On that day you will realize that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.

data.prayer: Father, we pray the believers are good spiritual stewards of their everyday relationships in Bhojpur, Bihar, India.
Lord, let it be said of the 2,698,387 lost in Bhojpur that you have called them out of darkness into your glorious light.
data.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light

data.prayer: Lord, you sent Jesus as a witness to testify about the light so that all the Mukeri people might believe through him.
Father, defend those who are loyal to your Word in the county of Bhojpur, even against fierce enemies.
data.verse: Though the wicked bind me with ropes, I will not forget your law.

data.prayer: Father, help the 30,012 believers in Bhojpur to know that you can make a big impact through their simple obedience today.
data.verse: you will be for me a kingdom of priests

data.prayer: Lord, like in the church of Antioch, where you gathered many prophets and teachers, please gather many prophets and teachers in the county of Bhojpur, Bihar, India.
data.verse: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.

location.name: Bhojpur
location.people_groups_list: Beldar Laria (Hindu traditions), Musahar (Hindu traditions), Bhalla, Laheri (Muslim traditions), Amat
